column26: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; Salicylic acid-induced gene expression in wild-type Col-0 and mutant ube4 Arabidopsis thaliana plants
column27: Salicylic acid-induced gene expression in wild-type Col-0 and mutant ube4 Arabidopsis thaliana plants
column28: Illumina HiSeq 2500 sequencing; Salicylic acid-induced gene expression in wild-type Col-0 and mutant ube4 Arabidopsis thaliana plants
column29: Protocols: Seedlings were collected with forceps and blotted dry on paper tissue. Subsequently seedlings were placed into a 2 ml screw-cap tube and immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen before storing at -80 degrees celcius.  Seeds were sterilised for 5 min. with 70% ethanol followed by 5 min. with 10% bleach and thoroughly washed with sterile water. Seeds were then resuspended in sterile 0.5% agar. Seeds were germinated on vertical standing MS plates supplemented with 1X Gamborg vitamins. Growth conditions: 16/8 hours light/dark cycle with 120 mol m-2 s-1 light and 22 degrees Celsius.  Seedlings were placed in 6-well plates and immersed in 10 ml of water or 0.5 mM SA.  1) Grind tissue very fine in liquid nitrogen. 2) Add 0.5 ml RNA extraction buffer (warmed to ~80ºC) and 0.5 ml phenol:chloroform:isoamylalcohol mixture (25:24:1). Vortex vigorously. 3) Centrifuge max. speed for 5 min. at 4ºC, but do not put samples on ice. 4) Transfer the aqueous phase (upper phase) to a new tube. 5) Add 0.5 ml cold chloroform:isoamylalcohol (24:1) and vortex vigorously. 6) Centrifuge max. speed for 5 min. at 4ºC, but do not put samples on ice. 7) Repeat steps 4, 5, and 6. 8)Transfer the aqueous phase to a new tube on ice and add 1/3 volume of 8 M LiCl.  9) Incubate overnight at 4ºC. 10) Centrifuge max. speed for 15 min. at 4ºC. A small clear pellet of total RNA should  be visible. From now on keep tubes on ice at all times. 11) Without disturbing the pellet, very carefully remove the ...

A small clear pellet of total RNA should  be visible. From now on keep tubes on ice at all times. 11) Without disturbing the pellet, very carefully remove the ...
